channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Greater Sarasota Chamber of Commerce hosts annual Leadership Awards
item.description: TheGreater Sarasota Chamber of Commercewill host the annual Celebrate Outstanding Leadership Awards on Aug. 13 from 11:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. at Michael’s On East in Sarasota.

item.title: The Big Beautiful Bill and its big opportunity for wealthy families
item.description: If you’ve ever felt like everything shifted overnight – tax laws, investment dynamics, retirement realities – you’re not imagining it. The Big Beautiful Bill, signed July 3, may seem like political theater, but for affluent families, it quietly reshapes how wealth is saved, transferred, and preserved.

item.title: See the winners of the Herald-Tribune's 2025 Sarasota-Manatee Top Workplaces
item.description: How do you judge the quality of a workplace? Ask the experts: The employees.

item.title: Open kitchen shelves may look great, Marni says, but are they for you?
item.description: I know it’s tempting. You see those clean, uncluttered open shelves in kitchens, with their matching ceramic dishes, beautifully staged glassware, lots of negative space, and you think, “Why not? If my kitchen had open shelving, my belongings would look great, too! Plus, everything would be so easy to reach.”

item.title: Marni's sentimental guide to giving the past a presence in our homes
item.description: Over the years, I have earned the reputation as the stuff police. I am forever nagging you to purge, declutter, toss, donate, edit, dump, oust, clear, lighten up and let go. But today, sit down, I am going to sentimentally suggest that some old things you should keep.

item.title: Walking the rightsizing walk. Here's why I decided to sell the house
item.description: I should know by now, if you venture into an exploratory hypothetical conversation with a real estate broker, you might as well start packing. One casual conversation with a broker friend started the house hurricane.

item.title: St. Thomas Aquinas survives Cardinal Mooney in Kickoff classic
item.description: FORT LAUDERDALE — Cardinal Mooney wanted a chance to test their mettle against not only a top program in the state, but in the nation.

item.title: 11,000 gallons of sewage spill into Hatchett Creek in Venice
item.description: VENICE – About 11,000 gallons of untreated wastewater spilled in Hatchett Creek early Friday near the intersection of East Venice and Warfield avenues after failure of a contractor’s pumping equipment as part of a city sewer pipeline project.

item.title: Vote for best 2025 high school football team in Manatee…
item.description: High school football teams are getting ready to take the field for the first time in the 2025 season on Friday, Aug. 15.

item.title: Bear Warriors United fights Florida’s December bear hunt
item.description: A wildlife conservation group has filed a complaint against the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission, saying it violated state law in how it developedrules to resume an annual black bear hunting season.

item.title: FST Cabaret salutes Peter, Paul and Mary and other folk legends
item.description: FST Cabaret salutes Peter, Paul and Mary and other folk legends

item.title: Sarasota’s performing arts center trails other major local projects
item.description: Seven years ago, Sarasota unveiled an ambitious plan for its bayfront — a reimagined 53-acre waterfront park crowned by a state-of-the-art performing arts center to replace the agingVan Wezel, funded equally by private donations and public dollars.

item.title: Football Roundup: Venice cruises past Gadsden; Booker edges Manatee in ugly win
